summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message delivered by Pastor Travis Hearn (PT) about putting God first in every area of our lives! In this sermon titled 'First Things First', PT challenges us to examine whether we're truly following Jesus or just wanting Jesus to follow our plans. Drawing from Luke 9, he passionately unpacks how many Christians say they'll follow Jesus, but always have a 'but' attached - 'I'll follow you, BUT...' Using humor and real-life illustrations, PT breaks down how we can practically prioritize God in three key areas: our schedule, our finances, and our relationships. Can you imagine how transformative our lives would be if we truly put God first in everything? The sermon is a wake-up call, reminding us that being a Christian isn't just an identity, but a radical commitment to following Jesus without excuses. From discussing the importance of keeping the Sabbath to challenging our approach to tithing, PT delivers a message that's both convicting and inspiring. His message isn't about making us feel guilty, but about helping us experience the fullness of life when we make God our true priority.
mainPoints: God must be first in my schedule
God must be first in my finances
God must be first in my relationships

versesMentioned.text: As they were walking along the road, a man said to him, 'I will follow you wherever you go.' Jesus replied, 'Foxes have dens and birds have nests, but the Son of Man has no place to lay his head.' He said to another man, 'Follow me.' But he replied, 'Lord, first let me go and bury my father.' Jesus said to him, 'Let the dead bury their own dead, but you go and proclaim the kingdom of God.'
For you created my inmost being; you knit me together in my mother's womb. I praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made; your works are wonderful, I know that full well.
You shall have no other gods before me.
But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.
Remember the Sabbath day by keeping it holy. Six days you shall labor and do all your work, but the seventh day is a sabbath to the Lord your God.
A tenth of everything from the land, whether grain from the soil or fruit from the trees, belongs to the Lord; it is holy to the Lord.

Will a mere mortal rob God? Yet you rob me. But you ask, 'How are we robbing you?' In tithes and offerings. You are under a curse—your whole nation—because you are robbing me. Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house. Test me in this,' says the Lord Almighty, 'and see if I will not throw open the floodgates of heaven and pour out so much blessing that there will not be room enough to store it.'
As iron sharpens iron, so one person sharpens another.
Do not be misled: Bad company corrupts good character.
Do not be yoked together with unbelievers. For what do righteousness and wickedness have in common? Or what fellowship can light have with darkness?

Monday.scripture: Matthew 6:21: 'For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.'
Monday.action: Review your calendar and bank statement. Identify areas where God is not first. Write down three specific ways you can intentionally put God first this week.
Monday.prayer: Lord, reveal the areas of my life where I'm not truly prioritizing You. Give me wisdom and courage to make You my first priority in everything.

Tuesday.scripture: Deuteronomy 6:5: 'Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength.'
Tuesday.action: Create a personal worship playlist. Spend 30 minutes listening and reflecting on songs that draw you closer to God.
Tuesday.prayer: God, teach me what it means to love You completely. Help me surrender every part of my heart to You.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 3:9-10: 'Honor the Lord with your wealth, with the firstfruits of all your crops; then your barns will be filled to overflowing, and your vats will brim over with new wine.'
Wednesday.action: Review your giving. If you don't currently tithe, research and take steps to begin giving 10% of your income.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, help me trust You with my finances. Give me a generous heart that honors You first.

Thursday.scripture: Proverbs 13:20: 'Walk with the wise and become wise, for a companion of fools suffers harm.'
Thursday.action: Evaluate your closest relationships. Identify one relationship that doesn't draw you closer to God and seek godly counsel about it.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, guide my relationships. Help me surround myself with people who encourage my spiritual growth.

Friday.scripture: Joshua 24:15: 'But as for me and my household, we will serve the Lord.'
Friday.action: Make a personal covenant with God. Write down your commitment to put Him first in a specific area of your life.
Friday.prayer: God, I choose You today. Help me follow through on my commitment to serve You wholeheartedly.

Saturday.scripture: Romans 12:1-2: 'Therefore, I urge you, brothers and sisters, in view of God's mercy, to offer your bodies as a living sacrifice, holy and pleasing to God—this is your true and proper worship.'
Saturday.action: Spend extended time in prayer, asking God to reveal any areas where you're holding back from fully surrendering to Him.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, I want to be a living sacrifice. Reveal any barriers preventing me from completely surrendering to Your will.
